title: The Godfather
description: Crime saga about power, family, and loyalty. Masterclass in filmmaking.

title: Citizen Kane
description: The rise and fall of a media tycoon. Changed cinema forever.

title: Schindler’s List
description: A brutal, haunting story of the Holocaust and redemption.

title: Casablanca
description: A WWII love triangle full of iconic lines and moral stakes.

title: Pulp Fiction
description: Violent, funny, nonlinear storytelling that reshaped ‘90s cinema.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
description: Visually unmatched sci-fi epic. Philosophical and hypnotic.

title: The Shawshank Redemption
description: Prison escape drama that hits every emotional beat perfectly.

title: The Godfather Part II
description: A rare sequel that deepens the original. Parallel stories done right.

title: Star Wars: A New Hope
description: The blockbuster that started it all. Space opera meets myth.

title: The Lord of the Rings: ROTK
description: Climactic, emotionally massive conclusion to the fantasy trilogy.

title: Apocalypse Now
description: A nightmarish journey into war and human darkness.

title: Goodfellas
description: Fast-paced, slick, and brutally honest look at mob life.

title: Chinatown
description: Hard-boiled detective story with a bleak, unforgettable ending.

title: The Dark Knight
description: Grounded superhero film that plays like a crime thriller.

title: Fight Club
description: Anti-consumerist, chaotic, and endlessly quotable.

title: Psycho
description: A psychological horror blueprint. Still creepy as hell.

title: Spirited Away
description: Magical, emotional, and visually stunning. Anime at its peak.

title: The Empire Strikes Back
description: Deeper, darker, and better than the original.

title: 12 Angry Men
description: A single room, one jury, and endless tension. Still hits hard.

title: La Dolce Vita
description: A dreamy, philosophical stroll through modern decadence.

title: The Matrix
description: Reality-bending sci-fi that blew minds and redefined action.

title: Titanic
description: Historical romance meets disaster epic. Massive scale, massive success.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest
description: Rebellion, control, and insanity in one of Nicholson’s best.

title: Lawrence of Arabia
description: Sweeping epic of desert warfare and identity. Old-school grandeur.

title: Taxi Driver
description: A slow descent into madness. Gritty, moody, and unforgettable.

title: Seven Samurai
description: Samurai epic that laid the groundwork for modern action films.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
description: Serial killer thriller with unforgettable performances.

title: Vertigo
description: Obsession, illusion, and vertigo — Hitchcock’s most complex film.

title: Back to the Future
description: Sci-fi adventure with heart, humor, and one killer DeLorean.

title: Dr. Strangelove
description: Satirical, cold war comedy about nuclear annihilation. Still timely.

title: Amadeus
description: Wild, operatic story of Mozart’s genius and madness.

title: The Green Mile
description: Death row fantasy-drama with heart-wrenching emotion.

title: Rashomon
description: Perspective-shattering story about truth and perception.

title: The Pianist
description: Survival during the Holocaust told through raw, haunting piano notes.

title: Whiplash
description: Intense, obsessive pursuit of greatness. Painful and electric.

title: City of God
description: Brazilian crime drama that hits hard and never lets up.

title: The Departed
description: Scorsese’s Boston crime tale. Twists, betrayals, and a stacked cast.

title: Inglourious Basterds
description: Alt-history revenge fantasy with Tarantino’s sharpest edge.

title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
description: Love, loss, and memory in one of the most original modern romances.

title: Requiem for a Dream
description: Addiction spiral filmed like a waking nightmare.

title: The Lion King
description: Shakespearean tragedy dressed as Disney animation. Iconic soundtrack.

title: The Shining
description: Kubrick + King = slow-burning horror classic with icy tension.

title: Toy Story
description: First full-length CG film. Smart, emotional, and forever charming.

title: Alien
description: Sci-fi horror with perfect pacing and a monster that defined the genre.

title: Pan’s Labyrinth
description: Fairy tale meets fascist Spain. Dark, beautiful, and devastating.

title: Oldboy
description: Brutal revenge thriller from South Korea. Twisted and stylish.

title: There Will Be Blood
description: Greed, oil, and power in one of the best modern American films.

title: The Seventh Seal
description: A knight plays chess with Death. Existential and haunting.

title: Grave of the Fireflies
description: Heartbreaking animated tale of war’s toll on innocence.

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
description: A quirky, colorful, bittersweet gem from Wes Anderson.

title: Blade Runner
description: Neo-noir cyberpunk soaked in mood and philosophical dread.

title: The Social Network
description: Facebook’s origin story told like a courtroom thriller.

title: Django Unchained
description: Tarantino’s bloody revenge Western with style and bite.

title: Life Is Beautiful
description: Holocaust drama that balances heartbreak with humor and hope.

title: The Truman Show
description: Reality, media, and identity wrapped in a brilliant premise.

title: Rocky
description: Underdog story with real grit and heart. Iconic training montage included.

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
description: Stylized, violent, and slick martial arts revenge thrill ride.

title: Parasite
description: Class warfare thriller that stunned the world — and the Oscars.

title: The Great Dictator
description: Chaplin’s satire of fascism. Still relevant, still bold.

title: Her
description: AI love story that’s more human than most human relationships.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
description: A cocaine-fueled capitalist fever dream. Scorsese’s wildest ride.

title: No Country for Old Men
description: Bleak, tense, and nihilistic. Coen brothers at their most ruthless.

title: The Big Lebowski
description: Weird, hilarious, and endlessly quotable. The Dude abides.

title: Prisoners
description: Bleak and suspenseful child abduction drama with moral grey zones.

title: The Thing
description: Cold, paranoid, shape-shifting sci-fi horror. Carpenter’s masterpiece.

title: Inside Out
description: Emotionally intelligent animation that hits adults just as hard.

title: A Clockwork Orange
description: Violence, free will, and twisted ultraviolent satire.

title: The Exorcist
description: The gold standard for possession horror. Still scary as hell.

title: Heat
description: Cops vs. criminals in one of the best shootouts and character face-offs.

title: American History X
description: Redemption and hate in a brutal, unflinching drama.

title: WALL·E
description: Sci-fi environmentalism with zero dialogue — and total emotional punch.

title: The Intouchables
description: Feel-good French drama about friendship across class and disability lines.

title: The Revenant
description: Visceral survival tale. DiCaprio bleeds for that Oscar — literally.

title: The Sound of Music
description: Wholesome AF, but undeniably timeless and tuneful.

title: Stand by Me
description: Nostalgic coming-of-age story that still packs emotional weight.

title: The Iron Giant
description: Cold War-era animation with surprising heart and soul.
WWI shot like a single-take video game mission. Beautiful and tense.

title: Fargo
description: Small-town crime story, pitch-black humor, and perfect accents.

title: Arrival
description: Language, loss, and time. Cerebral alien story that sticks with you.

title: Boogie Nights
description: The rise and fall of a porn star. Stylish and sleazy in all the right ways.

title: Mulholland Drive
description: Lynchian mind-warp of identity and Hollywood nightmares.

title: The Princess Bride
description: A fairy tale that mocks itself while being sincerely great.

title: Slumdog Millionaire
description: Destiny, love, and game shows. Bollywood energy with Western polish.

title: Ghostbusters
description: Supernatural comedy that just works. Effortlessly fun.

title: Children of Men
description: Dystopian thriller that feels way too real. Bleak brilliance.

title: Donnie Darko
description: Time travel, mental illness, and a creepy bunny — cult classic status.

title: Gone Girl
description: Dark, twisty commentary on marriage, media, and manipulation.

title: The Handmaiden
description: Erotic thriller wrapped in deception. Korean cinema at its most elegant.

title: The Florida Project
description: Childhood on society’s edge. Heartbreaking, beautiful, real.

title: Little Miss Sunshine
description: Dysfunctional family road trip with laughs and tenderness.

title: Monsters, Inc.
description: Pixar at its peak: inventive world-building and warm storytelling.

title: Trainspotting
description: Scottish heroin addicts, punk energy, and unforgettable visuals.

title: A Separation
description: Iranian drama about class, religion, and divorce. Simple but masterful.

title: The Lives of Others
description: East German surveillance thriller that hits with real emotional gravity.

title: The Secret in Their Eyes
description: Argentinian mystery with a knockout long take and a brutal twist.

title: Barry Lyndon
description: Kubrick’s underrated period piece. Cold, calculated, and stunning.

title: Dead Poets Society
description: Seize the day. A tearjerker about inspiration and conformity.

title: The Last Emperor
description: Lavish biopic with stunning scope and an Oscar sweep to back it up.

title: The Hunt (Jagten)
description: Danish drama about moral panic and accusations. Mikkelsen kills it.

title: Black Swan
description: Psychological ballet nightmare. Aronofsky’s most stylish mindtrip.
